item.title: Beogram 4000: Replacement of Sensor Arm Light Bulb with an LED
item.description:
The last incandescent bulb in this Beogram 4000 restoration project was replaced with an LED. The solution involved creating a custom flexible PCB equipped with a current limiting resistor and a bypass to mimic the higher energy draw of a traditional light bulb. item.title: TripAdvisor simplifies the process of capturing important moments during a trip
item.description:
TripAdvisor, the biggest travel website globally as of July 2015 according to comScore Media Metrix, has introduced a “Travel Timeline” feature for its mobile app. This feature allows users to record and share their travel experiences. When turned on, it automatically generates a timeline of the places visited and photos taken at each location. This timeline can be viewed chronologically or as a route on a map. Adam Medros, TripAdvisor’s SVP of Global Product, highlights the feature’s value in documenting and sharing travel memories...

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5513): Replacement of Sensor Arm Bulb with an LED Assembly
item.description:
During the restoration of a Beogram 4002 turntable, the light bulb in the sensor arm, crucial for record detection, was replaced with a longer-lasting LED. To ensure compatibility with the turntable’s bulb detection circuit, which disables record detection if a bulb failure is detected, the LED assembly was designed to mimic the current draw of the original bulb. LEDs inherently use less current, so a parallel current path was added to the LED board to compensate...

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5501): Sensor Arm Light Bulb Replacement - Final Version
item.description:
This post follows up on my previous writing about replacing incandescent sensor arm bulbs in Beogram 4002 turntables with LEDs. I’ve found that the LED PCB is best positioned 2.5 mm deep in the sensor compartment’s bulb cavity. This maximizes sensor response, likely because light bulb filaments sit slightly lower than the bulb’s rim. For a consistent solution, I designed a 3D-printed wedge that affixes to the flexPCB with epoxy and positions the LED at the optimal depth...
